member.name: T:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo
member.summary: Contains comprehensive information about a phone number validation result. This class represents the parsed and validated data for Egyptian phone numbers.
member.remarks: The PhoneNumberInfo class is the primary data structure returned by phone number validation operations. It contains both the original input and parsed components with validation status and carrier information.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.OriginalNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the original input phone number as provided by the user.
member.value: The raw phone number string exactly as entered, including any formatting, spaces, or special characters.
member.remarks: This property preserves the exact user input for audit trails and debugging purposes. It is not modified during the validation process.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.CleanedNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the phone number after cleaning and normalization.
member.value: The phone number with all non-digit characters removed, but before any country code or prefix transformations.
member.remarks: This intermediate representation is used internally during validation and contains only numeric digits.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.Number
member.summary: Gets or sets the final formatted phone number in local format.
member.value: The complete phone number in standard Egyptian format (e.g., "01234567890"). This is the canonical representation used for storage and display.
member.remarks: The number includes the carrier prefix and subscriber number in a consistent format without international dialing codes.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.Prefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the carrier prefix (first 4 digits of the phone number).
member.value: A 4-digit string representing the carrier-specific prefix that identifies the mobile network operator (e.g., "0123" for Vodafone Egypt).
member.remarks: The prefix determines both the carrier and service type. Each prefix is assigned to specific mobile operators by the National Telecom Regulatory Authority (NTRA).

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.Carrier
member.summary: Gets or sets the mobile network carrier name.
member.value: The name of the telecom operator providing service for this number (e.g., "Vodafone Egypt", "Orange Egypt", "Etisalat Misr", "We").
member.remarks: Carrier information is derived from the prefix using NTRA's official numbering plan for Egypt.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.ServiceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of telecommunication service.
member.value: A string describing the service category: "Mobile" for regular mobile numbers or "Value Added Service" for special service numbers.
member.remarks: Service type classification helps differentiate between standard mobile services and premium/specialized services with different billing rates and regulations.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.IsValid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the phone number is valid.
member.value: true if the phone number passes all validation checks including format, length, and prefix verification; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property represents the overall validation status. When false, the property contains details about the validation failure.

member.name: P:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the error message describing validation failure.
member.value: A descriptive error message in Arabic and English explaining why the phone number failed validation. Empty string when validation succeeds.
member.remarks: Error messages are designed to be user-friendly and help identify specific issues with the input phone number.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the phone number validation result.
member.returns: A formatted string containing key validation information including the phone number, validation status, carrier, and any error message.
member.remarks: This method is primarily used for debugging and logging purposes. The format is: "Number: {Number}, IsValid: {IsValid}, Carrier: {Carrier}, ErrorMessage: {ErrorMessage}"

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.
member.param: The object to compare with the current object.
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to the current object; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Two PhoneNumberInfo objects are considered equal if their properties are equal, regardless of other properties.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as the default hash function.
member.returns: A hash code for the current object.
member.remarks: The hash code is based on the property.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of the current PhoneNumberInfo object.
member.returns: A new PhoneNumberInfo object with the same property values.
member.remarks: This method creates a completely independent copy that can be modified without affecting the original object.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.ToInternationalFormat
member.summary: Formats the phone number for international dialing.
member.returns: The phone number in international format with Egypt country code (+20).
member.remarks: This method assumes the number is already in valid Egyptian format. It prepends the international access code and Egypt country code.

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.ToDisplayFormat
member.summary: Formats the phone number for display with standard spacing.
member.returns: The phone number formatted with spaces for readability.
member.remarks: The standard Egyptian format is: 0XXX XXX XXXX (e.g., "0123 456 7890")

member.name: M:NumericValidation.EG.Models.PhoneNumber.PhoneNumberInfo.IsComplete
member.summary: Validates that all required properties are populated for a valid phone number.
member.returns: true if the object represents a complete valid phone number; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs additional consistency checks beyond the basic IsValid flag, ensuring that all derived properties are correctly populated.
